meanings.definition: The perceived decrease in temperature caused by the combination of actual air temperature and wind speed.
meanings.sent1: When the windchills are low, it feels much colder outside.
meanings.sent2: I checked the weather report for the windchills before going out.
meanings.sent3: The windchills were so strong that my hot coffee turned cold in minutes.
meanings.sent4: The windchills cut through my jacket like icy knives.
meanings.sent5: The biting windchills made me shiver uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: To calculate the windchills, meteorologists use a formula that takes into account both the air temperature and wind speed.
meanings.sent1: Meteorologists often need to windchills to predict how cold it will feel.
meanings.sent2: I will windchills the data to provide an accurate forecast.
meanings.sent3: She decided to windchills the numbers one more time, just to be sure.
meanings.sent4: The scientist carefully windchills the variables to avoid errors.
meanings.sent5: We should windchills the results before making any conclusions.
